item.title: Don't link to "Here"
item.description: You shouldn't use "here" for links - TL;DR: Stop saying you can download something here or that you should click here to see something since it doesn’t make sense in most occasions, like mobile devices, screen readers, and grammar cohesion. When you’re creating almost anything on the internet, you can probably link to another resource. We see...

item.description: A easy-to-switch Gmail alternative for privacy - It’s recently come to my attention via multiple methods, such as the DuckDuckGo help pages when I was looking in to the search bar on the home page. On the DuckDuckGo help pages, multiple email providers are offered, but ProtonMail is the only one with a viable free plan. To...

item.title: Device Naming Guidelines
item.description: The guidelines in which I name my devices - Quick Syntax OS(ver).TP-Name Example WIN10.PC-EthanMB OS Computers Windows WIN WSV (Server) MacOS MAC Linux LNX Ubuntu LUV (Linux Ubuntu Vanilla) LUS (Linux Ubuntu Studio) Debian DEB Phones Android AND AD[C] ([codename first letter]) iOS iOS TVos KODI KDI ver If necessary, also provide the version of the OS in hyphenated...

item.title: Git Terminology
item.description: Understanding what all this git stuff means - I’m still a bit novice to Git, even after more than a year of kind of using it often. I’ll be explaining most terms that are useful in the best way I can. Commit A commit is a change to a repository. You can change multiple files with one commit...

item.title: EthanMcBloxxer's Subtitle Etiquette
item.description: A simple and minimal syntax for writing subtitles - Basic reference: Keep periods on the inside of open/close tags (like this.) Never use UPPERCASE for tag insides, use only lowercase for sounds (sound), [descriptive subtitles], {editorial note} Use hyphens for continued speech or a screened character “Quotes mean someone’s talking, but we don’t know who…” thoughts shouting (if possible...

item.title: Run Linux GUI Applications on Windows 10
item.description: Using WSL, Ubuntu, and VcXsrv to open Linux programs - With Windows Subsystem for Linux, you can now run “Linux” on top of Windows. You can get certain distributions from the Microsoft Store, like Ubuntu, Debian, Kali, OpenSUSE (Server), and Fedora. You can also use PowerShell or curl to download them. item.description: Looking at the top 10 languages and finding the best - In this post, I’ll be looking at the top 10 by native speakers, and seeing which of them meets my set criteria for being a language better than English, or in a way, perfect. item.title: Opera GX Review
item.description: Reviewing Version: 72.0.3815.xxx - What is Opera GX? Opera GX is a browser created for “gamers”. item.title: Password Misconceptions
item.description: There are a few misconceptions about passwords and security. - Passwords are one of the best things of security. They’re a string of text that can be remembered or written down, but there are still misconceptions and misinformation about them. mW674p3#NAeUG3UE would make a good password This, to many people, doesn’t sound like a misconception, it sounds like a fact....

item.title: Typing Accent Marks without a Bilingual Keyboard
item.description: Use the ENG-INTL keyboard modifier to type accent marks - Have you ever wanted to type accent marks for multilingual typing? Today, I’ll teach you about an integrated Windows feature to do just that by simply typing the accent (‘ “ ` ~ ^) and then the proceeding character.
